trial_identification.studytitle: Farming fit? Depression and obesity in farm men and women
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Study the effect of physical activity on obese/overweight farm men and women on their psychological health and obesity related clinical co-morbidities

conditions.healthcondition: Nutritional assesment in in obese/overweight farm men and women
Physical activity assesment in obese/overweight farm men and women

interventions.interventions:
Physical activity program (designed by an exercise physiologist) - to perform at least 3 times a week for a period of six months 1. Walking - 20 minutes 2. Full double squat -20 repetitions 2 sets 3. Forward bend leg kick back - 20 repetitions 2 sets 4. Wall push up - 20 repetitions 2 sets 5. Double heel raise - 20 repetitions 2 sets 6. Chair pushup - 20 repetitions 2 sets 7. Prone alternating side arm lifts - 20 repetitions 2 sets 8. Neutral back -10 repetitions 1 set 9. Double Gastroc step stretch -2 repetitions 1 set 10. Half kneel quad stretch- 2 repetitions 1 set 11. Arm extend neck sidebend - 2 repetitions 1 set 12. Doorway pec stretch - 2 repetitions 1 set
Telephone coaching - all the participants are to be contacted by the research assistant (trained by the exercise physiologist) to coach at once a month for 30 minutes for six month period. Video - Demostration (exercise) video will be provided to all the participants in the intervention group
interventions.comparator: Control group -no coached physical activity program

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in biochemical chemical meassurements (fasting blood glucose (FBG), Lipid profile, Serum/salivary cortisol)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Baseline, Final( 6-month), 3-month additional for salivary cortisol

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvements in anthropometric meassurements (Weight, height, waist circumference (WC), hip circumference (HC), Body fat %)
Improvement in self-rated psychological health meassurements (Deppression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) score)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement diet( adherence to healthy balanced diet - using dietary recall questionnaire)
Improvemt of physical activity (adherence to higher physical activty- using physical activity questionnaire)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Body mass index (BMI) >=25 kg/m2 Rural victorian farmers
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Age below 18 years or over 74 years Not been farming for more than 5 years Very high level of psychological distress Participants unable to participate physical activity program due to any other chonic illness

trial_design.concealment: Convenient sample (initial group of participants in intervention and later recruited group control)

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: National Centre for Farmer Health Hamilton Hospital Western District Health Service P O Box 283 HAMILTON VIC 3300

fundingsource.fundingname: beyondblue -Victorian Centre of Excellence in Depression and Related Disorders (bbVCoE)

secondarysponsor.sponsoraddress: School of Medicine Faculty of Health Medicine Nursing & Behavioural Sciences Geelong Campus at Waurn Ponds Deakin University Pigdons Road Geelong VIC 3217 Australia

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to identify the effect of physical activity on health indicators including circulating cortisol levels, anthropometric measures and psychological distress.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Deakin University Human Research Ethics Committee
